admin.description: The address with privileged access to update config

allowed_coins.description: Whitelisted coin denoms approved by governance

allowed_vaults.description: Whitelisted vaults approved by governance that implement credit manager's vault interface Includes a deposit cap that enforces a TLV limit for risk mitigation

max_close_factor.description: The maximum percent a liquidator can decrease the debt amount of the liquidatee

max_unlocking_positions.description: The maximum number of unlocking positions an account can have simultaneously Note: As health checking requires looping through each, this number must not be too large. If so, having too many could prevent the account from being liquidated due to gas constraints.

oracle.description: The Mars Protocol oracle contract. We read prices of assets here.

red_bank.description: The Mars Protocol money market contract where we borrow assets from

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

oneOf.description: Mints NFT representing a credit account for user. User can have many.
Update user's position on their credit account
Update contract config constants
Internal actions only callable by the contract itself

Action.description: The list of actions that users can perform on their positions

oneOf.description: Deposit coin of specified denom and amount. Verifies if the correct amount is sent with transaction.
Withdraw coin of specified denom and amount
Borrow coin of specified amount from Red Bank
Repay coin of specified amount back to Red Bank
Deposit coins into vault strategy If amount sent is None, Rover attempts to deposit the account's entire balance into the vault
Withdraw underlying coins from vault
Requests unlocking of shares for a vault with a required lock period
Withdraws the assets for unlocking position id from vault. Required time must have elapsed.

Pay back debt of a liquidatable rover account for a bonus. Requires specifying 1) the debt denom/amount of what the liquidator wants to payoff and 2) the request coin denom which the liquidatee should have a balance of. The amount returned to liquidator will be the request coin of the amount that precisely matches the value of the debt + a liquidation bonus. The debt amount will be adjusted down if: - Exceeds liquidatee's total debt for denom - Not enough liquidatee request coin balance to match - The value of the debt repaid exceeds the maximum close factor %

debt_coin.description: The coin debt that the liquidator wishes to pay back on behalf of the liquidatee. The liquidator must already have these assets in their credit account.

liquidatee_account_id.description: The credit account id of the one with a liquidation threshold health factor 1 or below

request_coin_denom.description: The coin they wish to acquire from the liquidatee (amount returned will include the bonus)

oneOf.description: Pay back debt of a liquidatable rover account for a via liquidating a vault position. Similar to LiquidateCoin {} msg and will make similar adjustments to the request. The vault position will be withdrawn (and force withdrawn if a locked vault position) and the underlying assets will transferred to the liquidator. The `VaultPositionType` will determine which bucket to liquidate from.
Perform a swapper with an exact-in amount. Requires slippage allowance %.
Add Vec<Coin> to liquidity pool in exchange for LP tokens
Send LP token and withdraw corresponding reserve assets from pool
Refunds all coin balances back to user wallet

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

CallbackMsg.description: Internal actions made by the contract with pre-validated inputs

oneOf.description: Withdraw specified amount of coin from credit account; Decrement the token's asset amount;
Borrow specified amount of coin from Red Bank; Increase the token's coin amount and debt shares;
Repay coin of specified amount back to Red Bank; Decrement the token's coin amount and debt shares;
Calculate the account's max loan-to-value health factor. If above 1, emits a `position_changed` event. If 1 or below, raises an error.
Adds coin to a vault strategy
Exchanges vault LP shares for assets
Used to update the account balance of vault coins after a vault action has taken place

account_id.description: Account that needs vault coin balance adjustment

previous_total_balance.description: Total vault coin balance in Rover

oneOf.description: Requests unlocking of shares for a vault with a lock period
Withdraws assets from vault for a locked position having a lockup period that has been fulfilled
Pay back debts of a liquidatable rover account for a bonus
Perform a swapper with an exact-in amount. Requires slippage allowance %.
Used to update the coin balance of account after an async action

account_id.description: Account that needs coin balance adjustment

previous_balance.description: Total balance for coin in Rover prior to withdraw

oneOf.description: Add Vec<Coin> to liquidity pool in exchange for LP tokens
Send LP token and withdraw corresponding reserve assets from pool
Checks to ensure only one vault position is taken per credit account
Refunds all coin balances back to user wallet

ConfigUpdates.description: Used when you want to update fields on Instantiate config

Decimal.description:
A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0

The greatest possible value that can be represented is 340282366920938463463.374607431768211455 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)

oneOf.description: Rover contract-level config
Configs on vaults
Whitelisted coins
All positions represented by token with value
The health of the account represented by token
Enumerate coin balances for all token positions; start_after accepts (account_id, denom)
Enumerate debt shares for all token positions; start_after accepts (account_id, denom)
Total debt shares issued for Coin
Enumerate total debt shares for all supported coins; start_after accepts denom string
Enumerate all vault positions; start_after accepts (account_id, addr)
Get total vault coin balance in Rover for vault
Enumerate all total vault coin balances; start_after accepts vault addr
Estimate how many LP tokens received in exchange for coins provided for liquidity
Estimate coins withdrawn if exchanged for LP tokens

coin.description: Coins that are awaiting to be unlocked (underlying, not vault tokens)

id.description: Unique identifier representing the unlocking position. Needed for `ExecuteMsg::WithdrawUnlocked {}` call.
